description: From Middle English ropy, from rope + -y.

adjectives.description: ropy (comparative ropier or more ropy, superlative ropiest or most ropy)

entries.meaning: Resembling rope in appearance or texture, used especially of muscles that are thick or hard to the touch.
examples: Hence, myofascial pain is usually associated with a taut band, indicating a "ropey" thickening of muscle tissue.

entries.meaning: Capable of forming rope-like or thread-like structures.
(Britain, colloquial) Of poor quality; in poor health.
(of milk or another liquid) Slimy, as after the action of Enterobacter aerogenes in syrup.
